revised_title: Chemical Analysis of Ficus rubiginosa Resin and a New Homologue of Benzylic Alcohol
tldr: The authors discovered a new alcohol homologue in the Ficus rubiginosa plant, which they named Acetate of Sycoceryl. They analyzed its chemical properties and found it to be a natural acetic ether. They also isolated a new member of the benzylic alcohol series with the composition C30H30O3.
